intro: Orthocarpus densiflorus var. obispoensis, commonly known as the Obispo thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in coastal and inland regions. It features small white to pale yellow flowers and has a bushy, herbaceous growth habit. This variety is distinguished by its dense flowering and is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution.
